alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:13AM EST until January 10 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Maine... Penobscot At Bangor affecting Penobscot County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot at Bangor. * WHEN...Until early this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Bangor Waterfront begins to flood in portions of the river walk. Flood control systems and barriers in Kenduskeag Plaza may become stressed. At 14.0 feet, High water levels in the Kenduskeag Plaza channel. Catch basins and storm water systems begin backing up into Kenduskeag Plaza parking areas and lowest levels of parking garages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.0 feet this morning around the time of high tide. - Flood stage is 11.6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
